_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:54:55 using v2.0
title: Have there been changes in support for community mental health service users?
analysis_commentary: Of all the support types mentioned, help in finding or keeping work was the least supported, as reported by the service users in both years (43% said they did not get any support in 2011 and 2012). The proportion of people who received no support for care responsibilities increased by 4.0% between the two years. The proportion of people who received no support for finding or keeping accommodation, and no support with financial advice or benefits, both decreased by 1.0%. The area with the least support in both years was those needing support for physical health needs, although this increased by 5.0% in the last year surveyed.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
